title: Sub Question 3
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

_ _ I _ _ I _ vv I _ _ I _ vv I _ x I
Spondee-Spondee-Dactyl-Spondee-Dactyl-Spondee

S-S-D-S-D-S
Note: All six feet must be addressed. The student must write out the entire Latin line.

title: Sub Question 4
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum
Translation (1 point):

tears, weeping, crying, sobbing, teardrops; lamentation(s), wailing(s)
Note: Other words are possible but must convey the action of crying, tears.

Identification (1 point):

Accusative

title: Sub Question 5
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum
dark, black, bloody, dirty, filthy, dusty; pierced, punctured, swollen, swelling
Note: While a brief (even a single word) answer may be acceptable, it must clearly reflect comprehension of lines 5-6 and not merely general recall of other passages in the epic.
descriptions:

title: Sub Question 6
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum
the fall / burning / destruction / loss / sack of Troy / the city; ambush on Troy / the city; attack / invasion of the Greeks from the Trojan Horse; arrival / acceptance of the (Trojan) horse into Troy / the city; admittance of the Trojan Horse
